Issues.Title: Micro frontend architecture with Vue
Issues.Body:
We are building a platform using Vue. This platform will be deployed on kubernetes. In order to make this platform extensible we would like to implement micro frondend (https://micro-frontends.org/) like architecture. This means people (within or outside our organization) who want to extend our platform should be able to build extensions where each of these extensions will be deployed in separate k8s namespaces. Each namespace may contain one or more micro vue applications and one or more micro services. 

I have looked into pages feature of vue cli but not sure if this really addresses this problem. Is it possible  to implement micro frondend like architecture using vue?

I am author of a java based portal platform. A portal is like a big web application which allows one to create and design layout of pages at run time (https://github.com/pistonportal/piston-docs/wiki/Page-components-and-types). It also allows one to register micro web applications (called app in Piston and portlet, widget etc in other platforms), which are developed by different teams in same or different organizations. One can then place these micro web applications on different portal pages.

I am not looking for all portal features (e.g. creating pages at runtime at this moment, placing more than one apps on a portal page etc). All we need is that different teams from same or different organizations should be able to develop micro frontends which can be a full module (e.g. a functionality launched by clicking a top level link in header) or a small feature (e.g. user management which can be launched through a link embedded in user profile pop up menu).

Issues.Title: Prevent rerender of child components that use $listeners (fix #7257)
Issues.Body:
## Issue

### Reproduction link
https://jsfiddle.net/xb4172g8/

### Steps to reproduce
Open console and observe while typing something into input fields
Enter some text into name field -> Vue re-renders all three Textfield components
In line 21 replace { ...this.$listeners } with an empty object
Once again enter some text into any field -> Vue re-renders only updated Textfield

Child components that use the $listeners attribute are rerendered each time the parent component is
updated. This is due to the updateChildComponent function that sets the reactive property
vm.$listeners thus triggering a rerender of the child component. 

## Solution

One possible solution would be to compare the new listeners with the previous listeners. But since these are javascript functions, we cannot compare them.
It is important to note however that the listeners of the child component are updated later within the updateChildComponent function. Updating the vm.$listeners attribute should therefore not trigger any of the subscribers as the virtual DOM is eventually updated later on.

This change therefore provides a new toggleNotifyingSubscribers method that disables a reactive property's ability to notify its subscribers. We use this method to prevent the vm.$listeners property from rerendering the child component.

fix #7257

Issues.Title: Support for apps loaded from Windows file shares
Issues.Body:
When loading an application from a Windows file share (not mapped to a network letter), Chrome will throw an error (`cannot be created in a document with origin 'null'`) when `replaceState` is called. This happens because while `protocol` is `file:` and `host` is `vboxsvr` the `origin` is `file://` as opposed to `file://vboxsvr`. This means the absolute path is not created correctly.

Only Windows shares that are not mapped to a drive letter are affected. If a drive letter is mapped then while origin will still be `file://`, pathname will include the information instead (e.g. `/Z:/dist/index.html`)

This code removes the reliance on the origin attribute and calculates the absolute path from `protocol` and `host`.

Issues.Title: Disable Direct State Mutation Outside of Mutation Handlers, at Least in Strict Mode
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
As [doc](https://vuex.vuejs.org/guide/strict.html) said, 

> In strict mode, whenever Vuex state is mutated outside of mutation handlers, an error will be thrown. 

However, **state will still be mutated** though an error would be thrown. 

In my opinion, this behavior is weird and misleading. Normally,  operation would fail if an error showed. But in this case, it didn't. 

Also, if a developer doesn't see this error and only see the result which is actually worked, he might do this behavior all the time until one day he find the error.

 So, my propose is

>  Why Not Disable Direct State Mutation Outside of Mutation Handlers, at Least in Strict Mode?

There should be a way to absolutely disable direct state mutation outside of mutation handlers. 

### What does the proposed API look like?
```js
const store = new Vuex.Store({
  // ...
  strict: true
})
```
Direct state mutation outside of mutation handlers would be disabled when `strict` is true.
